Table of Contents

Name


CplantFamilyStatus, CplantFamilyStatusGrp

Synopsis


#include <cplant.h> int CplantFamilyStatus(jobFamilyInfo *job) int CplantFamilyStatusGrp(jobFamilyInfo *job, int nMembers P, int *\ fPrankList, int tmout)

Description


The function CplantFamilyStatus sends a request to yod2 for the current status of the job specified by job. job is a handle returned by CplantSpawnJob, CplantMyParent or CplantMySelf. It is a pointer to a structure that contains a status field and an error indicator, and these field are updated when the call returns. The function CplantFamilyStatusGrp is a collective job status call. Every process that participates in the status request operation must make the call with the same list of participants. nMembers is the number of processes participating in the call, rankList is the list of participating process ranks, and tmout is the number of seconds to wait before judging a collective operation among the pariticpants to be a failure. In our implementation of this call, the first process in the rankList makes the request to yod2 and broadcasts the results to the others. If nMembers is zero, or rankList is NULL, then this is taken to mean that all processes in the application are participating.

Return Value


Both functions return -1 on error, and 0 on success. On success, the fields in the job structure are updated. This is the jobFamilyInfo structure: CRtypedef struct _jobFamilyInfo{
int job_id; /* Cplant job id */
int yodHandle; /* yod2 needs this */
int status; /* bit map of JOB_* values */
int nprocs ; /* number of processes*/
int error; /* normally 0, -1 if an error occurred */
void *callerHandle; /* caller can use this, we don't */
}jobFamilyInfo; CR#define JOB_NODE_REQUEST_BUILT ( 1 << 0)
#define JOB_PCT_LIST_ALLOCATED ( 1 << 1)
#define JOB_REQUESTED_TO_LOAD ( 1 << 2)
#define JOB_GOT_OK_TO_LOAD ( 1 << 3)
#define JOB_APP_STARTED ( 1 << 4)
#define JOB_APP_FINISHED ( 1 << 5)
#define JOB_APP_MASS_MURDER ( 1 << 30)

See Also


yod2 CplantSpawnJob CplantMyParent CplantMySelf
